Docs.summary: Represents the base class for a tabular data-bound control that is composed of other server controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class serves as the base class for a composite server control that binds to data from a data source. A composite server control is a control that is built from a combination of other server controls. Page developers do not use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class directly; instead, they use controls that derive from this class. Examples of composite data-bound controls include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> controls.
Classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> control must override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method to create the control hierarchy. To access the child controls of a composite data-bound control, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.Controls%2A> collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a custom composite data-bound control that displays the values of a data source in a table.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1/CS/idataitemcontainersample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1/VB/idataitemcontainersample.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the child controls within the composite data-bound control.
Docs.value: A that represents the child controls within the composite data-bound control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A composite data-bound control is a combination of one or more server controls. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.Controls%2A> property to manage these child controls. You can add, remove, or iterate through the server controls in the collection.

Docs.summary: Creates the control hierarchy that is used to render a composite data-bound control.

Docs.summary: Creates the control hierarchy that is used to render a composite data-bound control based on the values that are stored in view state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method is a helper method that is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class to create the control hierarchy for a composite data-bound control. This overload of the method creates the control hierarchy based on values from view state, rather than directly from the data source.

Docs.summary: When overridden in an abstract class, creates the control hierarchy that is used to render the composite data-bound control based on the values from the specified data source.
Docs.returns: The number of items created by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method is a helper method that is used by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class to create the control hierarchy for a composite data-bound control. When extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl> class, you must override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls> method to create your own control hierarchy. For more information on creating a composite control, see [Developing Custom ASP.NET Server Controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fbe26c16-cff4-4089-b3dd-877411f0c0ef).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeDataBoundControl.CreateChildControls%28System.Collections.IEnumerable%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method in a custom control to create the control hierarchy.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1/CS/idataitemcontainersample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer_1/VB/idataitemcontainersample.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting this property causes model binding to be used as the data-binding method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](/aspnet/web-forms/overview/presenting-and-managing-data/model-binding/retrieving-data).
